title: Advanced Research Training in Finance
abstractText:
This programme will provide advanced level training in finance for research students, supervisors and other researchers at UK universities. The programme addresses three strands of the Scheme Specification, namely:

  • the provision of advanced training and development activities for researchers
  • the provision of specific training activities for research students
  • the provision of 'training the trainer' activities.

The programme will cover three core areas:

  • asset pricing
  • corporate finance
  • financial econometrics.

Through a series of focussed and intensive modules extending over three years, the programme will provide participants with access to advanced level training from experts who are internationally recognised in their respective fields, drawn from both the UK and overseas.

Building on existing training provision that is delivered at the individual institutional level, the programme will expose doctoral students and researchers to state-of-the-art research methods in finance and provide an opportunity for them to exploit recent developments in their discipline for the benefit of their research careers. By helping to build research capacity in the subject of finance in UK universities, the programme will have a lasting impact on the quality of finance research undertaken in the UK, and on the relative importance of this research globally.
impactText: The series of workshops, which was attended by research students and early career researchers from across the UK, has helped to build research capacity in the area of Finance through a number of channels. First, research students were provided with subject-specific training at a level and intensity not typically available within their own institutions, nor through any other regional or national programme. Second, the programme has provided students and researchers with opportunities for establishing and maintaining lasting and potentially collaborative networks at both the national and international level. Third, by targeting supervisors and other researchers as well as research students, the programme has contributed to the research infrastructure in finance in the UK. findingsText: The programme provided advanced level training in the discipline of finance for research students, supervisors of research students and other researchers at UK universities. The programme covered three core areas of finance: asset pricing, corporate finance and financial econometrics. Through a series of focussed and intensive modules extending over three years, the programme provided participants with access to sustained advanced level training from experts who are internationally recognised in their respective fields, drawn from both the UK and abroad. The research students, supervisors and other researchers who attended the programme have acquired subject-specific skills and knowledge in three core areas of finance. These skills can be directly used in research, either in academia or industry. Education,Financial Services, and Management Consultancy
